name: CVE-2017-0099
description: Hyper-V in Microsoft Windows Vista SP2; Windows Server 2008 SP2 and 2008 R2; Windows 7 SP1; Windows 8.1; Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2; Windows 10 Gold, 1511, and 1607; and Windows Server 2016 allows guest OS users, running as virtual machines, to cause a denial of service via a crafted application, aka "Hyper-V Denial of Service Vulnerability." This vulnerability is different from those described in CVE-2017-0098, CVE-2017-0074, CVE-2017-0076, and CVE-2017-0097.
pattern: [(software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_server_2012:r2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_server_2008:r2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_server_2016:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_7:*:sp1:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_10:1511:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_10:1607:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_8.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_vista:*:sp2:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_server_2008:*:sp2:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_server_2012:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_10:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*')]
